properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm
properties.headline: Gale Warning issued January 8 at 3:17PM PST until January 9 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Small Craft Advisory, southwest winds 15 to 25 kt
with gusts up to 30 kt and seas 7 to 12 feet at 12 seconds. For
the Gale Warning, north winds 20 to 30 kt with occasional gale
force gusts and steep to very steep seas 10 to 15 ft. For the
Hazardous Seas Watch, very steep and hazardous seas 17 to 22
feet at 16 seconds possible.

* WHERE...Gales and very steep seas will affect areas generally
beyond 2 NM from shore with Small Craft Advisory conditions
elsewhere. Warning level seas are possible all areas late
Friday night to Saturday.

* WHEN...For the Gale Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 10 AM
PST Thursday. For the Small Craft Advisory, until 10 PM PST
Thursday. For the Hazardous Seas Watch, from late Friday night
through Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...During the advisory period, small boats and
inexperienced mariners could encounter conditions that could
jeopardize safety. During the warning and watch periods,
strong winds and very steep seas could damage or displace
fishing gear. Very steep and hazardous seas could capsize or
damage vessels. Bar crossing will become especially
treacherous.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid strong winds and very steep
seas. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THURSDAY... ...GALE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
